title: Energy Minister updates on fuel availability
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Minister of Power and Energy, Kanchana Wijesekara states that about 4,000 MT of Petrol and Crude oil vessels are due to be unloaded on 9th May.
In a tweet regarding the country’s fuel availability, the Minister states that 4,000MT of Auto Diesel and 2,500MT of Octane 92 Petrol is released daily.
However, he adds that limited Auto Diesel will be released until the Norochcholai power plant is restored.

Update on Fuel AvailabilityOn an average 4000MT of Auto Diesel and 2500MT of 92 Petrol is released daily. More 92 released. Limited Auto Diesel released until the Norochcholai power plant is restored. Further 40000 MT of Petrol and Crude Oil vessels to be unloaded Monday. pic.twitter.com/hRUDshs7WW
Colombo – Negombo road obstructed due to protest demanding LP gas
